assumption.assumption: The Elastic Block Store (EBS) volumes provides reliable and durable block-level storage for Amazon EC2 instances and other services
EBS backup infrastructure is resilient and securely configured.
Security and availability of the cloud (including the database, the service, the infrastructure, the platform, etc.) is the responsibility of the cloud service provider (CSP) / data center
assumption.assumption_comment: As per Bosch guidelines, the cloud on-boarding team (BSI) is responsible for ensuring this and it must be informed of any security needs concerned with configuration of Cloud Infrastructure

assumption.assumption: The underlying cloud infrastructure supporting ECS is securely configured
assumption.assumption_comment: Proper security measures implemented to prevent threats and vulnerabilities

assumption.assumption: Data stored in S3 buckets is encrypted at rest.
assumption.assumption_comment: Without encryption, data could be vulnerable to exposure in the event of a breach or unauthorized access.

assumption.assumption: Use of S3 complies with relevant regulatory standards, industry best practices, and data protection laws applicable to their organization
assumption.assumption_comment: Implementing access controls and encryption, and regularly monitoring and auditing the system for potential security vulnerabilities.

assumption.assumption: Users configure access controls properly, utilizing IAM (Identity and Access Management) policies, S3 bucket policies, and Access Control Lists to restrict and manage access to their S3 resources
Logging and monitoring mechanisms are in place to track access to S3 buckets and detect any suspicious or unauthorized activity
assumption.assumption_comment: Without proper logging and monitoring, organizations may not be able to identify security incidents or breaches in a timely manner.

assumption.assumption: Organizations expect that CSPs will provide transparency regarding their security practices, including incident response procedures and communication in the event of a security incident
assumption.assumption_comment: Proactive maintenance, including the consistent application of the latest security patches and upgrades, is crucial for safeguarding assets and ensuring the overall security of system environments

misuse.muc_description: Unauthorized user gains access to an EBS volume and uses it for malicious purposes
misuse.muc_comment: This can have serious consequences, as the attacker may be able to steal data, disrupt operations or even launch attacks on other systems

misuse.muc_description: An attacker floods an EBS volume with a large number of read or write requests.
An attacker could exploit weak access controls to gain unauthorized access to the ECS environment, potentially leading to escalation of privileges
An attacker could intercept exposed data due to improperly secured network interfaces or access exposed secrets to gain unauthorized access
misuse.muc_comment: Improper secured network interfaces or exposed secrets

misuse.muc_description: Attackers can exploit container breakout vulnerabilities to gain unauthorized access to the underlying host operating system or to escape the container isolation boundary.
Attacker gaining access to an S3 bucket that contains sensitive data
misuse.muc_comment: This can have serious consequences, as the attacker may be able to steal

misuse.muc_description: Attacker gains unauthorized access to IAM credentials through phishing
Attackers can discover and access sensitive data stored in the buckets, leading to data exposure or unauthorized disclosure of information.
Insider threats can result in unauthorized access, data manipulation, or intentional deletion of critical data stored in S3.
An attacker gains unauthorized access to an EC2 instance, either through compromised credentials, vulnerabilities in the operating system or applications
misuse.muc_comment:
An unauthorized person gaining access to a system 
or information is a security concern. It can lead to data breaches, unauthorized changes, or other malicious activities. It is important to implement proper security measures, such as strong passwords and access controls, to prevent unauthorized access.

damageScenario.consequence_DS: Unauthorized reading of database or sniffing of communication may lead to disclosure and abuse of personally identifiable information
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Compliance to international and national legal privacy requirements and standards such as GDPR is mandatory and this may lead to penalties.

damageScenario.damage_scenario: Degradation or disruption or loss of functionality or unreliable operation
damageScenario.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or service itself.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time

damageScenario.damage_scenario: Damage to brand name / image / reputation
damageScenario.consequence_DS: Brand image can be adversely affected because of malfunction, compromise or hacking of system, or data breach or disclosure of security flaws
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Despite the contract limiting legal liability, brand image of Bosch is considered important enough to rate it as "serious". Negative publicity impacting brand value may impact future business and revenue. Customer confidence is affected. Competitive edge is diminished.

damageScenario.consequence_DS: Customer trust/confidence is important for future business. For example loss of private information of customer
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Trust of specific people, partners are violated, which in turn affect the future business with them and impacts the growth of the company.

damageScenario.consequence_DS: Manipulation of data Stored in AWS s3 will adversely affect functionality
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time

damageScenario.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time.

damageScenario.damage_scenario: Degradation, Disruption, or Loss of Functionality, or Unreliable Operation
damageScenario.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Functionality is a key user requirement, and the loss of functionality will lead to a loss of customer trust with contracting partners.

SecGoals.objective_description: Confidentiality - Only authorized users can have access to EBS volumes data
Integrity - Manipulation of data within EBS should not be done and data must maintain Integrity
Availability - The data stored in EBS volumes should not be disrupted or interrupted
Confidentiality - Ensure that data and information within ECS remain confidential, preventing unauthorized access or disclosure.
Integrity -  Containerized applications or services running within the ECS should not be tampered with
Availability -  Containerized services within ECS should be available to minimize the downtime and disruptions caused by security incidents
Versioning and lifecycle policies must be employed ensuring data accessibility and durability.
Amazon S3 ensures confidentiality by offering server-side encryption, secure data transfer with HTTPS, and fine-grained access controls through IAM and bucket policies.
S3 maintains data using checksums, hash functions, and versioning to prevent Man In the Middle attacks
Unauthorized users should not have access to the services
Availability of the service when needed

Integrity - Manipulation of data within EBS should not be done and data must maintain Integrity
Availability - The data stored in EBS volumes should not be disrupted or interrupted
Confidentiality - Ensure that data and information within ECS remain confidential, preventing unauthorized access or disclosure.
Integrity -  Containerized applications or services running within the ECS should not be tampered with
Availability -  Containerized services within ECS should be available to minimize the downtime and disruptions caused by security incidents
Versioning and lifecycle policies must be employed ensuring data accessibility and durability.
Amazon S3 ensures confidentiality by offering server-side encryption, secure data transfer with HTTPS, and fine-grained access controls through IAM and bucket policies.
S3 maintains data using checksums, hash functions, and versioning to prevent Man In the Middle attacks
Unauthorized users should not have access to the services

SecControls.security_control_description: Access control is a security control that restricts access to protected resources based on a set of defined rules, ensuring only authorized individuals or entities can access these resources. It plays a crucial role in data security and privacy by limiting exposure and minimizing the risk of unauthorized access, use, disclosure, or modification of sensitive information.
SecControls.security_goal: EBS shall implement comprehensive access controls for block level storage of EBS to prevent unauthorized access
SecControls.security_description_threat: EBS shall implement comprehensive access controls for block level storage of EBS to prevent unauthorized access
SecControls.consequence_DS: Unauthorized reading of database or sniffing of communication may lead to disclosure and abuse of personally identifiable information
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Compliance to international and national legal privacy requirements and standards such as GDPR is mandatory and this may lead to penalties.
SecControls.selectedRequirement: EISA-ACC-301 - Management of Authentication Secrets (EISA-PSA-003 - Database Management System) - Password Rules

SecControls.security_control_description: Encryption involves transforming data into a form that cannot be easily understood by unauthorized individuals. It is used to protect sensitive information, such as financial data, personal information, and intellectual property, from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction. Encryption algorithms use mathematical transformations to convert plaintext into ciphertext, which can only be decrypted using the correct encryption key.
SecControls.security_goal: EBS volumes shall implement robust encryption and data integrity mechanisms to ensure secure and durable storage for EC2 instances, minimizing the risk of data loss or performance degradation
SecControls.security_description_threat: EBS volumes shall implement robust encryption and data integrity mechanisms to ensure secure and durable storage for EC2 instances, minimizing the risk of data loss or performance degradation
SecControls.damage_scenario_copy: Degradation or disruption or loss of functionality or unreliable operation
SecControls.damage_scenario: Degradation or disruption or loss of functionality or unreliable operation
SecControls.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or service itself.
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time
SecControls.selectedRequirement: EISA-CRY-107 - Cryptographic Key Management (EISA-PSA-003 - Database Management System) - Cryptographic Key Management

SecControls.security_control_description: Redundancy involves the duplication of critical components or functions to ensure continuous availability and resilience in the event of a failure or disruption. By having redundant systems, organizations can reduce the impact of outages and maintain business continuity. This control helps prevent disruptions to operations, data loss, and downtime, ensuring that critical systems and services are available even when one component fails.
SecControls.security_goal: EBS shall employ redundancy and failover measures to maximize the availability of block-level storage and minimize potential downtime.
SecControls.security_description_threat: EBS shall employ redundancy and failover measures to maximize the availability of block-level storage and minimize potential downtime.
SecControls.damage_scenario_copy: Damage to brand name / image / reputation
SecControls.damage_scenario: Damage to brand name / image / reputation
SecControls.consequence_DS: Brand image can be adversely affected because of malfunction, compromise or hacking of system, or data breach or disclosure of security flaws
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Despite the contract limiting legal liability, brand image of Bosch is considered important enough to rate it as "serious". Negative publicity impacting brand value may impact future business and revenue. Customer confidence is affected. Competitive edge is diminished.
SecControls.selectedRequirement: EISA-ACC-301 - Management of Authentication Secrets (EISA-PSA-003 - Database Management System) - Changing Default Passwords

SecControls.security_control_description: Least Privilege is a security control that limits the privileges and permissions granted to users, applications, and systems to only those necessary to perform their intended functions. By limiting privileges, organizations can reduce the risk of unauthorized access to critical resources and mitigate the potential impact of security breaches. The principle of least privilege ensures that users and systems only have the minimum level of access required to fulfill their roles and responsibilities. By implementing this control, organizations can enhance the overall security posture of their systems and applications by minimizing the potential for privilege escalation and malicious activity.
SecControls.security_goal: The ECS environment shall enforce system and data integrity by using up-to-date execution environments and by restricting filesystem write access.

SecControls.selectedRequirement: EISA-ACC-202 - Restriction and Control of Privileged Accounts (EISA-PSA-003 - Database Management System) - Restriction and Control of Privileged Accounts

SecControls.security_control_description:
Network hardening involves implementing security measures to protect network resources from unauthorized access, damage, or disruption. It encompasses a range of techniques, including:

* **Firewall configuration:** Establishing rules to restrict access to and from the network based on IP addresses, ports, and protocols.
* **Intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDS/IPS):** Monitoring network traffic for suspicious activity and taking action to block or mitigate threats.
* **Virtual private networks (VPNs):** Encrypting network traffic for secure communication over public networks.
* **Network segmentation:** Dividing the network into smaller, isolated segments to limit the spread of threats.
* **Patch management:** Regularly updating software and systems to address vulnerabilities and security flaws.
* **Access control lists (ACLs):** Restricting access to network resources based on user identity and role.
* **Strong password policies:** Enforcing complex and unique passwords to prevent unauthorized access.
* **Data encryption:** Encrypting sensitive data to protect it from eavesdropping and theft.
SecControls.security_goal: The ECS environment shall prevent unauthorized disclosure by avoiding exposing network interfaces and by securely managing secrets.
SecControls.Threat_T: Integrity of Amazon Elastic Container Service
SecControls.security_description_threat: The ECS environment shall prevent unauthorized disclosure by avoiding exposing network interfaces and by securely managing secrets.

SecControls.selectedRequirement: EISA-ACC-202 - Restriction and Control of Privileged Accounts (EISA-PSA-003 - Database Management System) - Assignment of Privileged Access

SecControls.security_control_description: Monitoring involves the ongoing collection and analysis of security-relevant data to detect, identify, and mitigate security risks and incidents. It includes actively monitoring systems, networks, applications, and user activities to identify potential threats, unauthorized access, or malicious activity. Monitoring involves using tools and techniques such as log analysis, intrusion detection, vulnerability scanning, and network traffic analysis to gather and analyze data. It also includes continuous monitoring of user accounts, system configurations, and other security-related activities to detect anomalies, deviations from established baselines, or suspicious behavior that may indicate a security issue. The goal of monitoring is to provide real-time visibility into the security posture of the organization and to enable the timely detection and response to security incidents.
SecControls.security_goal: The ECS environment shall establish monitoring and anomaly detection
SecControls.security_description_threat: The ECS environment shall establish monitoring and anomaly detection
SecControls.affected_security_goal: Availability of Amazon Elastic Container Service
SecControls.consequence_DS: Customer trust/confidence is important for future business. For example loss of private information of customer
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Trust of specific people, partners are violated, which in turn affect the future business with them and impacts the growth of the company.

SecControls.security_control_description: Authorization is the process of granting access to resources based on a user's identity and the permissions associated with that identity. It helps ensure that only authorized users can access specific resources, preventing unauthorized access and potential data breaches. The authorization mechanism typically involves verifying the user's credentials, determining their access level, and granting or denying access based on pre-defined rules and policies. It helps establish a secure and controlled environment by restricting access to only those who have the necessary permissions, reducing the risk of unauthorized access and the potential compromise of sensitive data.
SecControls.security_goal: Access control mechanisms shall prevent unauthorized access
SecControls.security_description_threat: Access control mechanisms shall prevent unauthorized access
SecControls.consequence_DS: Manipulation of data Stored in AWS s3 will adversely affect functionality
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time

SecControls.security_control_description: Preventive controls are proactive measures designed to prevent security incidents from occurring in the first place. These controls focus on identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities, preventing unauthorized access, and ensuring the integrity of information systems.
SecControls.security_goal: EBS snapshots shall not be publicly restorable
SecControls.security_description_threat: EBS snapshots shall not be publicly restorable
SecControls.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time.

SecControls.security_control_description: Network segmentation involves dividing a network into smaller, isolated segments or subnets. Each segment is assigned a unique network address and access is restricted between segments using firewalls, routers, or other security devices. By isolating different parts of the network, segmentation can limit the spread of threats and improve overall security. For example, public-facing servers can be isolated from internal systems, reducing the risk of external attacks reaching critical data.
SecControls.security_goal: Amazon EC2 shall be configured to use VPC endpoints that are created for the Amazon EC2 service
SecControls.security_description_threat: Amazon EC2 shall be configured to use VPC endpoints that are created for the Amazon EC2 service
SecControls.consequence_DS: Customer trust/confidence is important for future business. For example loss of private information of customer
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Trust of specific people, partners are violated, which in turn affect the future business with them and impacts the growth of the company.

SecControls.security_control_description: Restrictive access is a security control that limits access to a system, resources, or data to only those individuals who have been authorized to do so. This is done to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access and to maintain the integrity of the system.
SecControls.security_goal: VPC default security groups shall not allow inbound or outbound traffic
SecControls.security_description_threat: VPC default security groups shall not allow inbound or outbound traffic
SecControls.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time.

SecControls.security_control_description: Logging involves recording and storing events and activities that occur within a system or network. It plays a crucial role in security by providing a historical record of actions, allowing for incident investigation, regulatory compliance, and security analysis. Logs can contain information such as user activities, system configurations, network traffic, and security events. They serve as an important tool for detecting and responding to security incidents, identifying anomalous behavior, and conducting security audits.
SecControls.security_goal: VPC flow logging shall be enabled in all VPCs
SecControls.security_description_threat: VPC flow logging shall be enabled in all VPCs
SecControls.damage_scenario_copy: Degradation, Disruption, or Loss of Functionality, or Unreliable Operation
SecControls.damage_scenario: Degradation, Disruption, or Loss of Functionality, or Unreliable Operation
SecControls.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Functionality is a key user requirement, and the loss of functionality will lead to a loss of customer trust with contracting partners.

SecControls.security_control_description: Network redundancy involves implementing multiple network paths or network elements to ensure continuous network connectivity and minimize the risk of downtime. It helps prevent disruptions and enables partial or full recovery of network services in case of component failures, infrastructure events, or other types of outages. By diversifying network paths and utilizing backup systems, network redundancy reduces the impact of network failures, enhances fault tolerance, and improves overall network reliability and availability.
SecControls.security_goal: Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection shall be up
SecControls.security_description_threat: Both VPN tunnels for an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection shall be up
SecControls.damage_scenario_copy: Degradation, Disruption, or Loss of Functionality, or Unreliable Operation

SecControls.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Functionality is a key user requirement, and the loss of functionality will lead to a loss of customer trust with contracting partners.

SecControls.security_control_description: Network Access Control Lists (ACLs) are a set of rules that define which network traffic is allowed to enter or leave a network. ACLs can be used to control access to specific hosts, networks, or services. They can also be used to restrict traffic based on source or destination IP address, port number, or protocol.
SecControls.security_goal: Network ACLs shall not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389
SecControls.security_description_threat: Network ACLs shall not allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0 to port 22 or port 3389
SecControls.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time.

SecControls.security_control_description: Network Access Control (NAC) is a security control that identifies, authorizes, and enforces access to the network based on pre-defined policies. It verifies the identity of devices, users, and applications attempting to connect to the network and grants access only to those that meet the specified security criteria. NAC systems typically use a combination of authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) protocols to enforce access control policies and provide centralized management and visibility into network access.
SecControls.security_goal: Security groups shall only allow unrestricted incoming traffic for authorized ports
SecControls.security_description_threat: Security groups shall only allow unrestricted incoming traffic for authorized ports
SecControls.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a tolerable period of time.

SecControls.security_control_description: Data retention involves establishing and implementing policies and procedures for the secure storage and disposal of sensitive data. This includes determining the appropriate retention period for different types of data based on business needs, legal and regulatory requirements, and privacy concerns. The control also includes measures to ensure the secure disposal of data when it is no longer needed, such as through encryption, deletion, or physical destruction.
SecControls.security_goal: Stopped EC2 instances shall be removed after a specified time period
SecControls.security_description_threat: Stopped EC2 instances shall be removed after a specified time period
SecControls.consequence_DS: Customer trust/confidence is important for future business. For example loss of private information of customer
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Trust of specific people, partners are violated, which in turn affect the future business with them and impacts the growth of the company.

SecControls.security_control_description: Network Configuration is the process of setting up and configuring the network devices and services to ensure secure network communication. It involves configuring network parameters such as IP addresses, routing protocols, firewalls, intrusion detection systems (IDS), and access control lists (ACLs). Network Configuration also includes implementing security measures such as network segmentation, virtual LANs (VLANs), and encryption.
SecControls.security_goal: Unused Network Access Control Lists shall be removed
SecControls.security_description_threat: Unused Network Access Control Lists shall be removed
SecControls.consequence_DS: Customer trust/confidence is important for future business. For example loss of private information of customer
SecControls.consequence_reasoning: Trust of specific people, partners are violated, which in turn affect the future business with them and impacts the growth of the company.

SecControls.security_control_description: Network Security safeguards the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of network resources and assets by implementing controls to protect against unauthorized access, damage, or disruption. It involves measures such as firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, access control lists, network segmentation, and encryption to secure network infrastructure, connections, and data in transit.
